content:
Eko can help businesses with their product development process in several ways:

1. Product feedback: Eko can provide valuable insights into how consumers interact with a product, which can be used to inform product development. By analyzing consumer engagement with interactive videos and 360-degree views, businesses can identify which features or benefits are most important to consumers and make adjustments to the product accordingly.
2. Prototype testing: Eko's interactive assembly guides can be used to test and refine product prototypes before they are released to the market. By getting feedback from consumers on the assembly process, businesses can identify potential design flaws or usability issues and make improvements before the product is mass-produced.
3. Marketing research: Eko's interactive experiences can be used to conduct market research and gather feedback on product concepts or prototypes. Businesses can create interactive videos or 360-degree views of different product variations and test them with a sample group of consumers to see which one is most popular.
4. Branding and storytelling: Eko's interactive experiences can help businesses create a strong brand identity and tell a compelling story about their products. By showcasing the features and benefits of a product in an engaging and interactive way, businesses can create a memorable and impactful brand experience for consumers.

Overall, Eko's platform can help businesses streamline their product development process and create products that are better suited to consumer needs and preferences. By providing valuable feedback and insights, businesses can make more informed decisions about product design, marketing, and branding.
